text:
sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen so today 
I am excited to finally be making look chin so

look chin is the nickname of my baby but it is also 
Asian style meatball so this is the meatballs that

you find in fur or in like any kind of noodle 
soups really and in Thailand you'll find them

on a stick grilled or deep-fried served with 
the sauce it's really good really popular it

can be made from any kind of meat really like 
fish pork chicken beef anything typically this

is not something people make at home because it's 
so easily bought from outside and is a little bit

labor-intensive to make at home but it is totally 
possible and it's not hard it just takes a little

bit of time and it's worth it to be honest because 
in commercial ones they add a lot of additives to

get that bouncy texture that is typical of book 
Qin so you don't want to eat too many chemicals

it's also a good thing to make at home alright 
let's get started so first we're gonna make a

paste of garlic and peppercorns to season the 
meatballs now yes we're gonna grind it and here

anyway but I want to make sure I don't get any big 
chunks of pepper or garlic so I'm gonna grind it

totally totally fine first in the mortar you can 
also microplane your garlic too if you want get

those black peppercorns finely ground I almost 
said found Lee found Lee grind you can do white

pepper totally fine okay now you got it super 
super fine I'm gonna add my garlic and get that

fine as well there you go you want it quite fine 
for this now this is very easy we're just gonna

throw everything into a food processor give it a 
blitz you want a pretty powerful food processor

for this because you want the texture to be quite 
fine if you don't have it I mean any food there's

gonna work but just know that the weaker the 
motor the more coarse the texture is gonna be

not a totally bad thing it's just something 
to expect so I've got here some ground pork

lean ground pork I should add and for this you 
definitely want lean I have tried this with not

lean ground pork and it just made the meatballs 
too mushy at the end however if you're gonna do

beef do the opposite because I found that lean 
ground beef is too lean and then it made the

meatballs too firm so I want the the beef to 
have a little bit more fat so also something

to play around with because everybody's lean 
ground beef at different stores in different

country is gonna be different so if you find 
that the texture is too soft at the end it

might be that there's too much fat in it okay 
I am going to add some seasoning which includes

soy sauce and salt a little bit of sugar is not 
gonna make the meatball sweet but it will create

a well-balanced flavor in the meatballs the sugar 
is really important also a little bit of tapioca

starch it's going to help sort of bind everything 
and gives it a bit of a bounce bounciness is sort

of a desired characteristics of these meatballs 
and the thing that's really really going to help

with bounciness is baking powder yes I don't 
actually know how it works but it does I have

made them without baking powder and with baking 
powder and you can really tell the difference

there it's much more bouncy with the baking 
powder commercially they add a different set

of chemicals that help to maximize the bounciness 
of these things which you can buy as well like in

Thailand it's it's sold in a package for making 
like hotdogs and meatballs and things like that

so if you want super bouncy you can buy one of 
those our garlic pepper paste goes in now we're

just gonna blitz this until everything is very 
very fine but there's one more thing I'm gonna

grab and that is ice I got ice cubes here and you 
want to be adding ice cubes as the motors going

when the motor is running it's gonna generate 
heat and it it's too hot the fat will sort of

separate out from the meat so the ice is added 
to keep everything cold and also the added water

from the ice contributes to that bounciness so I'm 
gonna run this machine and then just add the ice

cubes sort of one at a time as I go but now all 
my ice cubes are stuck together oh there we go

so make sure your ice cubes are not all 
stuck together okay and I've lost one

be careful the machine walks so pink everyone 
said keep an eye on the surface that it's on

because it's so there's so much stuff in it right 
now as it goes it kind of just slowly move so make

sure it's not gonna fall off your counter so we're 
still we still got a bit to go but I'm just gonna

stop to scrape just to redistribute things okay 
let's do one more scrape one thing that I noticed

happens with this machine is you blend it blend 
it blend it and the blade slowly gets lifted up

lifted up higher and higher like in the beginning 
it'll be flush against the bottom and then slowly

it gets higher because the poor kind of slowly 
goes in and lifts it up and then at some point

it's like it's floating now like it's not really 
touching the bottom and then so you get a layer

of pork at the bottom that I find doesn't get 
mixed as well see how like the pork gets all in

here and I think that like pushes the blade up as 
you go so what I'm gonna do is I want to take this

out put the blade back in and then put the pork 
back in so that I can thoroughly mix it it's a

complete pain in the butt you don't have to do it 
you can totally stop here but if you want a really

really fine texture it's something to consider 
doing and it's all like in the center here too

so I just I just go in and clean basically they've 
sent the mechanism that the blade is sitting on so

that I can do one more round with the blade 
properly situated just another minute or so

okay that looks better I mean to be honest 
with homemade meatballs it's never gonna be

as silky smooth as the commercially made one 
because we're just using home appliances here

but for me this is good enough mmm it's like 
pork soft-serve ice cream so that's it that is

the Luke chin mix and now is the hard part the 
meat ball squeezing party is about to begin so

here's your setup you want a pot of water that 
is not is hot and steaming but not boiling this

is important because if it's vigorously boiling 
boiling the Luke Qin is not gonna hold its shape

as well so there should be steam coming off but 
there should not be like movement bubbling in the

water so and then you want to take a bunch in your 
hand and here is where the action happens you're

gonna first squeeze this out yes I know it looks 
completely horrendous but to stick with me but

this doesn't look smooth right so what you're 
gonna do is you're gonna take your thumb pull

it back in and do another squeeze and now it's 
smoother pull it back in and do another squeeze

and when you're happy with how smooth it is I'm 
gonna start over because I'm not happy with that

when you're happy with how smooth it is then 
you're gonna Nick it off with a wet spoon and

you're gonna go against the long side so that 
it's a little rounder and then this plops into

the pot that is too hot let's show you that 
again so just keep watching so I squeeze it

and I just keep squeezing it up and then when I'm 
happy with how smooth it is I take it off with a

spoon and I drop it in the water you can make 
it bigger you can make it small it's up to you

and wet the spoon occasionally because it'll 
help the spoon not stick to the pork and the

first time you try it it's gonna feel like this 
is a complete disaster but trust me you will get

a hang of it and just let those go don't worry 
about them you at this temperature you can't

possibly overcook them or anything so they're just 
gonna hang out till you're done so I've got all my

balls squeezed now for those of you who want to 
see more of the squeezing technique maybe that

wasn't enough I have a whole separate video of me 
just squeezing these balls these meatballs and so

that you can just watch and follow along you can 
have it playing while you're making these so that

you can keep referring to it and watching me do

so you can see what it might look like the first

the ones that are on the stick so I'm gonna put
